ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: In them are two kinds of every fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: In both of them there will be every kind of fruits in pairs. --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: In both these is a pair of every fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In them there are pairs of each kind of fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In which are fruits of all kinds, each of two varieties.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: In them (both) will be every kind of fruit in pairs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: In both of them are two pairs of every fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: therein of every fruit two kinds --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: In both of them, there will be two kinds of every fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: In which will be of every fruit two kinds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: In both of them will be two kinds of every fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: In them (both) will be every kind of fruit in pairs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Therein are two kinds of every fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: In them are fruits of every kind, in pairs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:52] In both of them, of every fruit (fākiha) of [the fruits of] this world — or [it, fākiha, means] all those things in which one delights (yutafakkahu bihi) — there are two kinds, two varieties, one juicy, one dried, and those which in this world are bitter, like colocynth, will be sweet [therein].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs) both with regard to shape and taste.
